[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Get Real 0.2 platform defines requirements to guide students toward careers in computer science through engaging resources and interactive learning.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: Get Real supports career exploration, college planning, and interactive learning for high school students.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: Get Real integrates with OUS systems and search engines for visibility.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: Get Real provides intuitive web interfaces with dynamic visuals and seamless navigation.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: Get Real runs on servers optimized for responsive web hosting.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: Get Real supports Dreamweaver-built pages, CSS, and embedded media.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: Get Real uses secure HTTPS protocols for data exchange.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: Get Real is optimized for scalable hosting and high-volume media files.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: Get Real ensures 24/7 availability with scheduled maintenance and content updates.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: Get Real connects with RSS feeds for real-time content updates.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: Get Real enables career exploration, resource planning, and interaction with professionals.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Designed for high school students, teachers, and parents with varying knowledge of computer science.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: Get Real relies on OUS infrastructure and timely content updates.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: Get Real assumes an operational Dreamweaver setup and regular content updates.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Interactive Sections: Features like FAQs and Ask a Grad.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with search engines to enhance platform visibility.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall support embedded video links for multimedia content.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow students to explore computer science career paths (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall dynamically update content using RSS feeds (REQ-DB-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide clear navigation with visually engaging layouts.
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The system shall minimize text blocks by incorporating interactive elements and graphics.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall load pages within 2 seconds.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support up to 1,000 concurrent users.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store career and college-related content securely.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The database shall log and retrieve user activity for analytics.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall follow responsive web design principles.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The system shall comply with WCAG 2.1 accessibility standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall adhere to W3C standards for web development.
[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-002: The system shall comply with FERPA requirements for data privacy.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall dynamically scale based on traffic demand.
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall provide comprehensive logs for analytics and monitoring.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Includes usability testing, performance benchmarks, and compliance validation.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides, web design recommendations, and best practices for engaging educational platforms.
[SEC] 5. References: WCAG 2.1 standards, FERPA guidelines, and W3C documentation.
